description:
When the Office WLED (Office) is turned on, temporarily bring the Living Room light up to a bright, usable level, then restore the WLED’s original settings and turn the Living Room light back off after 10 minutes.

Because you explicitly said “Office Wled”, this automation uses the WLED strip named “Office” as the trigger and the target to restore. It also controls the light named “Living Room ” as the living room light. Note: both “Office” (WLED) and “Living Room ” are currently shown as unavailable in your context; the automation is still valid, but it will only work once those devices are online.

Home Assistant automation (YAML):
```yaml
alias: Office WLED → Temporary Living Room Lighting
mode: restart

trigger:
  - platform: state
    entity_id: light.wled
    to: "on"

variables:
  # Capture the Office WLED state at trigger time
  wled_was_on: "{{ trigger.from_state.state == 'on' }}"
  wled_brightness: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.brightness if 'brightness' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"
  wled_rgb: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.rgb_color if 'rgb_color' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"
  wled_effect: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.effect if 'effect' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"

action:
  # Step 1 – Turn on Living Room to ~80% brightness if it supports brightness
  - choose:
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ state_attr('light.living_room_2','supported_features')|int(default=0) is greaterthan 0 and state_attr('light.living_room_2','supported_features')|int(default=0) % 2 == 0 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
            data:
              brightness_pct: 80
    default:
      - service: light.turn_on
        target:
          entity_id: light.living_room_2

  # Step 2 – Wait 10 minutes
  - delay: "00:10:00"

  # Step 3 – Restore Office WLED to its previous state as best as possible
  - choose:
      # If WLED was on before, turn it back on with previous brightness/color/effect
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ wled_was_on }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              {% if wled_brightness is not none %}
              brightness: "{{ wled_brightness }}"
              {% endif %}
              {% if wled_rgb is not none %}
              rgb_color: "{{ wled_rgb }}"
              {% endif %}
              {% if wled_effect is not none %}
              effect: "{{ wled_effect }}"
              {% endif %}
    default:
      # If WLED was off before, turn it back off
      - service: light.turn_off
        target:
          entity_id: light.wled

  # Step 4 – Turn off the Living Room light
  - service: light.turn_off
    target:
      entity_id: light.living_room_2
```

This matches your clarified intent exactly: “When Office Wled is turned on, save its current state, turn Living Room on to ~80%, then after 10 minutes restore Office Wled and turn Living Room off.”
trigger_summary: Office WLED (Office) turning on (state of light.wled changes to on).
action_summary: Snapshot Office WLED’s prior state, turn the Living Room light on (targeting ~80% brightness), wait 10 minutes, then restore Office WLED to its saved state and turn the Living Room light off.

openai_response.description:
When the Office WLED (Office) is turned on, temporarily bring the Living Room light up to a bright, usable level, then restore the WLED’s original settings and turn the Living Room light back off after 10 minutes.

Because you explicitly said “Office Wled”, this automation uses the WLED strip named “Office” as the trigger and the target to restore. It also controls the light named “Living Room ” as the living room light. Note: both “Office” (WLED) and “Living Room ” are currently shown as unavailable in your context; the automation is still valid, but it will only work once those devices are online.

Home Assistant automation (YAML):
```yaml
alias: Office WLED → Temporary Living Room Lighting
mode: restart

trigger:
  - platform: state
    entity_id: light.wled
    to: "on"

variables:
  # Capture the Office WLED state at trigger time
  wled_was_on: "{{ trigger.from_state.state == 'on' }}"
  wled_brightness: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.brightness if 'brightness' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"
  wled_rgb: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.rgb_color if 'rgb_color' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"
  wled_effect: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.effect if 'effect' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"

action:
  # Step 1 – Turn on Living Room to ~80% brightness if it supports brightness
  - choose:
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ state_attr('light.living_room_2','supported_features')|int(default=0) is greaterthan 0 and state_attr('light.living_room_2','supported_features')|int(default=0) % 2 == 0 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
            data:
              brightness_pct: 80
    default:
      - service: light.turn_on
        target:
          entity_id: light.living_room_2

  # Step 2 – Wait 10 minutes
  - delay: "00:10:00"

  # Step 3 – Restore Office WLED to its previous state as best as possible
  - choose:
      # If WLED was on before, turn it back on with previous brightness/color/effect
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ wled_was_on }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              {% if wled_brightness is not none %}
              brightness: "{{ wled_brightness }}"
              {% endif %}
              {% if wled_rgb is not none %}
              rgb_color: "{{ wled_rgb }}"
              {% endif %}
              {% if wled_effect is not none %}
              effect: "{{ wled_effect }}"
              {% endif %}
    default:
      # If WLED was off before, turn it back off
      - service: light.turn_off
        target:
          entity_id: light.wled

  # Step 4 – Turn off the Living Room light
  - service: light.turn_off
    target:
      entity_id: light.living_room_2
```

This matches your clarified intent exactly: “When Office Wled is turned on, save its current state, turn Living Room on to ~80%, then after 10 minutes restore Office Wled and turn Living Room off.”
openai_response.trigger_summary: Office WLED (Office) turning on (state of light.wled changes to on).
openai_response.action_summary: Snapshot Office WLED’s prior state, turn the Living Room light on (targeting ~80% brightness), wait 10 minutes, then restore Office WLED to its saved state and turn the Living Room light off.

openai_response.description:
An enhanced version that still centers on Office WLED being turned on, but adds a smoother, more ambient experience: the Living Room light ramps to 80% over a few seconds, and the Office WLED does a brief subtle “confirmation glow” before returning exactly to its previous effect/color/brightness after 10 minutes.

This still uses only the devices you clarified: the WLED strip named “Office” as the trigger/restore target, and the “Living Room ” light as the living room output.

Home Assistant automation (YAML):
```yaml
alias: Office WLED → Ambient Living Room Boost
mode: restart

trigger:
  - platform: state
    entity_id: light.wled
    to: "on"

variables:
  # Capture the Office WLED state
  wled_prev_state: "{{ trigger.from_state.state }}"
  wled_prev_brightness: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.brightness if 'brightness' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"
  wled_prev_rgb: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.rgb_color if 'rgb_color' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"
  wled_prev_effect: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.effect if 'effect' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"

action:
  # Step 1 – Give Office WLED a quick confirmation pulse if possible
  - service: light.turn_on
    target:
      entity_id: light.wled
    data:
      brightness_pct: 100
  - delay: "00:00:01"
  - service: light.turn_on
    target:
      entity_id: light.wled
    data:
      brightness_pct: 60

  # Step 2 – Smoothly bring up Living Room light to 80%
  - service: light.turn_on
    target:
      entity_id: light.living_room_2
    data:
      brightness_pct: 10
  - delay: "00:00:02"
  - service: light.turn_on
    target:
      entity_id: light.living_room_2
    data:
      brightness_pct: 40
  - delay: "00:00:02"
  - service: light.turn_on
    target:
      entity_id: light.living_room_2
    data:
      brightness_pct: 80

  # Step 3 – Maintain this scene for 10 minutes
  - delay: "00:10:00"

  # Step 4 – Restore Office WLED exactly to prior state
  - choose:
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ wled_prev_state == 'on' }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              {% if wled_prev_brightness is not none %}
              brightness: "{{ wled_prev_brightness }}"
              {% endif %}
              {% if wled_prev_rgb is not none %}
              rgb_color: "{{ wled_prev_rgb }}"
              {% endif %}
              {% if wled_prev_effect is not none %}
              effect: "{{ wled_prev_effect }}"
              {% endif %}
    default:
      - service: light.turn_off
        target:
          entity_id: light.wled

  # Step 5 – Fade down Living Room light
  - service: light.turn_on
    target:
      entity_id: light.living_room_2
    data:
      brightness_pct: 40
  - delay: "00:00:02"
  - service: light.turn_on
    target:
      entity_id: light.living_room_2
    data:
      brightness_pct: 10
  - delay: "00:00:02"
  - service: light.turn_off
    target:
      entity_id: light.living_room_2
```

This version keeps your original behavior but adds smoother transitions and a brief visual confirmation from the Office WLED, making it feel more intentional and less jarring while still automatically cleaning up (restoring WLED and turning the Living Room light off).
openai_response.action_summary: Office WLED briefly pulses for visual confirmation, Living Room light ramps up to 80% in steps, scene holds for 10 minutes, then Office WLED is restored to its prior state and Living Room light fades down and turns off.

technical_prompt.alias: When the Office WLED (Office) is turned on, temporarily bring the Living Room light up to a bright,
technical_prompt.description:
When the Office WLED (Office) is turned on, temporarily bring the Living Room light up to a bright, usable level, then restore the WLED’s original settings and turn the Living Room light back off after 10 minutes.

Because you explicitly said “Office Wled”, this automation uses the WLED strip named “Office” as the trigger and the target to restore. It also controls the light named “Living Room ” as the living room light. Note: both “Office” (WLED) and “Living Room ” are currently shown as unavailable in your context; the automation is still valid, but it will only work once those devices are online.

Home Assistant automation (YAML):
```yaml
alias: Office WLED → Temporary Living Room Lighting
mode: restart

trigger:
  - platform: state
    entity_id: light.wled
    to: "on"

variables:
  # Capture the Office WLED state at trigger time
  wled_was_on: "{{ trigger.from_state.state == 'on' }}"
  wled_brightness: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.brightness if 'brightness' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"
  wled_rgb: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.rgb_color if 'rgb_color' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"
  wled_effect: "{{ trigger.from_state.attributes.effect if 'effect' in trigger.from_state.attributes else none }}"

action:
  # Step 1 – Turn on Living Room to ~80% brightness if it supports brightness
  - choose:
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ state_attr('light.living_room_2','supported_features')|int(default=0) is greaterthan 0 and state_attr('light.living_room_2','supported_features')|int(default=0) % 2 == 0 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.living_room_2
            data:
              brightness_pct: 80
    default:
      - service: light.turn_on
        target:
          entity_id: light.living_room_2

  # Step 2 – Wait 10 minutes
  - delay: "00:10:00"

  # Step 3 – Restore Office WLED to its previous state as best as possible
  - choose:
      # If WLED was on before, turn it back on with previous brightness/color/effect
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ wled_was_on }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: light.wled
            data:
              {% if wled_brightness is not none %}
              brightness: "{{ wled_brightness }}"
              {% endif %}
              {% if wled_rgb is not none %}
              rgb_color: "{{ wled_rgb }}"
              {% endif %}
              {% if wled_effect is not none %}
              effect: "{{ wled_effect }}"
              {% endif %}
    default:
      # If WLED was off before, turn it back off
      - service: light.turn_off
        target:
          entity_id: light.wled

  # Step 4 – Turn off the Living Room light
  - service: light.turn_off
    target:
      entity_id: light.living_room_2
```

This matches your clarified intent exactly: “When Office Wled is turned on, save its current state, turn Living Room on to ~80%, then after 10 minutes restore Office Wled and turn Living Room off.”
